article.headline: Stocks end higher as investors remain optimistic on stimulus prospects
article.body: Stocks ended higher Thursday, with analysts tying support to continued optimism over prospects for some form of additional fiscal stimulus despite a lack of progress on that front in Washington. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-California, said she opposed a standalone relief package for airlines, saying help would need to be accompanied by a broader bill. President Donald Trump has called for piecemeal support measures after previously calling off talks with Democrats until after the election. The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% rose around 123 points, or 0.4%, near 28,426, according to preliminary figures, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% advanced around 27 points, or 0.8%, to end near 3,447. The Nasdaq Composite COMP, +1.39% finished near 11,421, up around 56 points, or 0.5%. Deal activity was also a feature of Thursday's trade, with shares of Eaton Vance Corp. EV, -0.56% soaring 48% after Morgan Stanley MS, -0.34% said it was buying the fund manager in a deal valued at $7 billion. Morgan Stanley shares rose 0.7%.
